LG Electronics Posts Net Profit Surge, Flags Challenges -- Update
data.description:
By Kwanwoo Jun


LG Electronics' third-quarter net profit surged despite sluggish demand and tariff headwinds, as resilience in its home-appliance and auto-component segments offset weakness in its television business.

The South Korean consumer-electronics giant said Friday that net profit rose fivefold from a year earlier to 461.00 billion won, equivalent to $322.5 million, for the July-September period. Analysts had expected 287.50 billion won for the quarter, according to a FactSet-compiled consensus.

Although the results were better than market expectations, LG said it expects the global home-appliance market to remain challenging in the final quarter of the year, due to a slow recovery in demand and intensified competition.

For the third quarter, revenue fell 1.4% to 21.874 trillion won, and operating profit dropped 8.4% to 688.90 billion won, in line with the company's preliminary estimates.

LG's home-appliance and vehicle-component segments grew despite higher tariffs and soft demand in major global markets, with revenues rising 4.7% and 1.4%, respectively.

Revenue from its media and entertainment segment, which includes televisions and laptop computers, slumped 9.5%. Costs associated with marketing amid intensified competition and early retirement programs for employees in the segment weighed on operating profit.

The Korean electronics maker said Friday that it continues to be affected by President Trump's higher levies despite the U.S. trade agreement struck earlier this week. Under the deal, Washington would lower blanket tariffs on most Korean goods to 15% from 25% in exchange for a $350 billion investment from Seoul.

The U.S. maintains a 50% duty on steel and aluminum, key materials in many home appliances and auto parts, and recently expanded the tariffs to cover finished products.

The increasingly challenging trade environment has prompted LG to expand into new businesses, such as heating, ventilation and air-conditioning services, as well as nonhardware platforms like appliance subscriptions and online services.

The company has set an annual HVAC revenue target of 20 trillion won by 2030. It has also designated its new business of supplying advanced chiller systems to data centers and large-scale commercial buildings as a core future growth driver.

Earlier this month, LG raised $1.3 billion by selling a 15% stake in its Indian subsidiary in an initial public offering. The proceeds could provide the company with significant funding to improve its business structure and drive new initiatives for future growth, it said.

Kiwoom Securities analyst Kim So-won said that some of LG Electronics India's IPO proceeds could also be allocated to dividends and share buybacks to enhance investor returns. Kim was upbeat about India's home-appliance market, projecting growth of 14% annually through 2029.

Shares of LG Electronics ended flat after the results. The stock has underperformed the broader market this year, gaining by around 5% compared with the benchmark Kospi's 71% gain.


Write to Kwanwoo Jun at kwanwoo.jun@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-31-25 0355ET

Equinor ASA Announces Tone H. Bachke Will Leave Her Position on the Board of Directors, Effective 31 October 2025
data.description: Equinor ASA announced that Tone H. Bachke will leave her position on the Board of Directors and prioritize her executive responsibilities as EVP and CFO in SHV Holding N.V., a global company headquartered in the Netherlands. The change takes effect 31 October 2025.

data.title: Mitsubishi Electric Corporation Revises Earnings Guidance for the Fiscal Year Ending March 31, 2026
data.description:
Mitsubishi Electric Corporation revised earnings guidance for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026. For the year, the company expects revenue JPY 5,670.0 billion (increased JPY 270.0 billion from the previous forecast. Operating profit to be JPY 430.0 billion (unchanged from the previous forecast).

Revenue is expected to exceed the previous forecast mainly due to foreign exchange rates reconsidered in line with the weaker yen, in addition to sales growth mainly in the Infrastructure segment. Although the impact of the special measures under the Next-Stage Support Program has been reflected under certain assumptions, operating profit remains unchanged from the previous forecast since the company expects an increase in sales, a change in foreign exchange rates, and has been reflecting the impact of U.S. tariff policies on product prices.

data.title: Mitsubishi Electric Corporation Declares Interim Dividend of the Fiscal Year Ending March 31, 2026
data.description: Mitsubishi Electric Corporation declared interim dividend of JPY 25 per share of the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026 (increased JPY 5 year-over-year).
